name: Action for the Global Goals
description: In September 2015, 193 world leaders committed to the Global Goals for Sustainable Development. These are 17 Goals to achieve three extraordinary things by 2030.

activities.name: Introduction: The Global Goals
activities.description: An introduction to the Global Goals, what they are, and those that are most important to you.
activities.summary: An introduction to the Global Goals.

steps.description: Have you heard of the Global Goals before?
If you have heard of the Global Goals, which one do you care the most about?
Watch this introduction to the Global Goals by Emma Watson
Have you ever done a project in your community that supports the goals?

activities.name: Goal 1: No Poverty
activities.description: Explore this activity for ideas on practical things that you can do, and then share your story of what you have done to make an impact.
activities.summary: What No Poverty means, and things that you can do.

activities.name: Goal 2: Zero Hunger
activities.description: Around 1 in 8 people in the world were estimated to be suffering from chronic hunger. Even if you are lucky enough not to be among them, there might be people in your school, apartment block or neighborhood who are going to bed hungry.
activities.summary: What Zero Hunger means, and things that you can do.

steps.description: What do you already know about this goal?
Watch this video to understand more about Zero Hunger
Example Action: Donate to food banks
Example Action: Learn how to cook

activities.name: Goal 3: Good Health and Well-being
activities.description: Immunization currently averts an estimated 2 to 3 million deaths every year. An additional 1.5 million deaths could be avoided, however, if global vaccination coverage improves.
activities.summary: What Good Health and Well-being means, and things that you can do.

steps.description: What do you already know about this goal?
Watch this video to understand more about Good Health and Well-Being
Example Action: Use vaccination
Example Action: Volunteer at a hospital

activities.name: Goal 4: Quality Education
activities.description: If you are among the youth that has or had chance to go to school, you are lucky! There are a lot of reasons why youth and kids drop out of education.
activities.summary: What Quality Education means, and things that you can do.

steps.description: What do you already know about this goal?
Watch this video to understand more about Quality Education
Example Action: Donate your books
Example Action: Fundraise for a local shool

activities.name: Goal 5: Gender Equality
activities.description: In different countries the exposure of this issue is different but the fact is: Over 150 countries have at least one law that is discriminatory against women.
activities.summary: What Gender Equality means, and things that you can do.

steps.description: What do you already know about this goal?
Watch this video to understand more about Gender Equality

Example Action: Run a space about career planning for girls

activities.name: Goal 6: Clean Water and Sanitation
activities.description: More than 750 million people lack adequate access to clean drinking water. We are talking about access to the most needed resource for people to surive.
activities.summary: What Clean Water and Sanitation means, and things that you can do.

steps.description: What do you already know about this goal?
Watch this video to understand more about Clean Water and Sanitation

Example Action: Don't overuse water

name: A Better You
description: Leadership is a skill that you have probably heard a great deal about. People talk about the importance of leadership at school, at college, at work, and in your own personal life. But who needs leadership skills?

name: Understanding Robotics
description: Robots are all around us. They include robotic wearables, body parts, robots that deliver packages, companion robots for the elderly, medical devices, and even biomorphic drones.

activities.description: For years, scientists have sought to build aerial robots inspired by bees and other flying insects. But they always run into a fundamental problem: flying takes a lot of energy.

description: We are on the brink of a revolution that will fundamentally change the way we live, work, and relate to each other. It will be unlike anything humankind has experienced. It is called the 4th Industrial Revolution.

activities.description: As new inventions are being made at an increasingly faster pace, the world as we know it will continue to change at a faster and faster pace.
activities.summary: Some things have changed the way we look at the world forever.

name: Design & Innovation
description: Design is the process of envisioning and planning the creation of things to solve a need of or problem. Steve Jobs said that design is not just what it looks like and feels like. Design is how it works.

activities.name: Design thinking
activities.description: Design thinking is a technique to solve a problem. It's a creative process used by businesses and entrepeneurs that allows us to empathize and understand users needs, identify problems, and brainstorm ideas.
activities.summary: Explore the design thinking approach for problem solving. You don't need any materials to complete this activity.

steps.description: Do you already know the design thinking process is?

name: Exploring Our World
description: We inhabit a beautiful planet that provides its species with ample water and ideal levels of sunlight and breathable oxygen. However, we have exploited the generosity of planet Earth.

activities.name: Our world and its future
activities.description: The history of the universe is tremendous. If you stop and reflect, the story of humans is only one small piece of the greater puzzle. The Big Bang once sparked the first cell of life on this planet.
activities.summary: What makes planet Earth our unique home?.

steps.description: Watch this video to see David Attenborough share his brief story of life on our planet

activities.name: Neighborhood plant ecosystems
activities.description: There are hundreds of different plant species living in your neigborhood ecosystem. Scientists call this assortment of organisms biodiversity. Explore your local ecosystem and share what you discovered.

activities.name: Why are octopuses so intelligent?
activities.description: An octopus' brain is spread throughout their body so that all parts of their body can think. Each of the eight arms can do different things at the same time.

name: All About Energy
description: Between 1990 and 2020, global energy consumption increased by nearly 60%. The good news is that over the next 20 years, growth is predicted to be much lower, despite population growth.

activities.name: Energy and our world
activities.description: How we use energy today matters for how we will live tomorrow. Scientists have warned about the impact of burning nonrenewable fuels and what they do to our planet. Imagine the possibilities of new ways of generating, sharing and storing energy.
activities.summary: Our world is transforming as are new ways to transfer energy. You don't need any materials to complete this activity.

steps.description: Watch this video to explore energy and all the possibilities for the future

activities.name: Kinetic versus potential energy
activities.description: Energy allows both people and machines to do work. All energy can be classified as the energy of motion (kinetic energy) or stored energy (potential energy).
activities.summary: Explore the difference between kinetic and potential energy.

steps.description: Do you already know the difference between potential and kinetic energy?
Watch this video for an overview on energy types
Identify an everyday object that has potential energy

activities.name: Energy for the poor
activities.description: Over one billion people still do not have access to modern forms of energy like electricity or natural gas. Instead, the poor use wood fires for cooking or have to pay very high prices for diesel generators and batteries.
activities.summary: What is energy poverty, and how can it be solved?
